generif.text: Discovered IL-34 and its receptor CSF1 by functional screening of the extracellular proteome.
The different spatiotemporal expression of IL-34 and CSF-1 allows for complementary activation of the CSF-1R in developing and adult tissues.

study identifies IL-34 expression in the synovial tissue of patients with arthritis; this cytokine, as a downstream effector of TNFalpha and IL-1beta, may contribute to inflammation and bone erosions in rheumatoid arthritis
Data suggest a discrete role of IL-34 in inflammatory rheumatoid arthritis (RA) diseases.
IL-34 as a nonredundant cytokine for the development of Langerhans cells during embryogenesis as well as for their homeostasis in the adult skin.
IL-34 levels were significantly increased in patients with coronary artery disease (CAD), and positively correlated with hs-CRP levels, suggesting that IL-34 may be an independent predictor of CAD.
the feline CSF-1R was cloned and the responsiveness to CSF-1 and IL-34 from a range of species, was examined.
These findings suggest that IL-34 may play a role in the pathogenesis of rheumatoid arthritis.
This study is the first to illustrate downstream transcriptional profiles and pathways of IL-34 in comparison with CSF-1 and identify notable differences in CCR2 expression.
Data suggest that CSF-1R-independent actions of IL-34 via receptor-type protein-tyrosine phosphatase zeta (PTP-zeta) might be considered in evaluating IL-34 roles in development and disease.
Circulating IL-34 levels in rheumatoid arthritis correlated with autoantibody production.
IL-34 expression in human gingival fibroblasts, stimulated by TNF-alpha and IL-1beta
IL-34 is associated with insulin resistance.
IL-34 promotes the development, survival, and function of microglia and Langerhans cells; therefore, this cytokine may predominately function in brain and skin biology.[review]

These results suggest that IL-34, a novel osteoclastogenic cytokine, plays a role in rheumatoid arthritis-associated joint damage and is a potential biomarker for predicting subsequent radiographic progression in patients with RA.
potent profibrotic factor in hepatitis C virus liver fibrosis
IL-34 is induced by IL-22 in the inflammatory cascade in response to IAV infection.
In vitro and in vivo experiments indicate that IL-34 expression is regulated by TNF-a and IL-1b and that its overexpression is associated with an increase in osteosarcoma growth and metastasis.
This paper provides evidence of alternative binding of IL-34 to chondroitin sulphates and syndecan-1 at the cell surface that modulates M-CSFR activation.
IL-34 is up-regulated in inflammatory bowel disease and suggest a role for this cytokine in sustaining the inflammatory responses in this disease
the expression pattern of IL-34 in ileum and colon and suggest IL-34 as a new modulator of inflammation in inflammatory bowel disease
findings demonstrated that M-CSF binds to IL-34; molecular docking studies predicted the formation of a heteromeric M-CSF/IL-34 cytokine
IL-34 is expressed by human FOXP3+CD45RCloCD8+ and CD4+ Tregs and markedly inhibited alloreactive immune responses.
miR-28-5p-IL-34-macrophage feedback loop modulates hepatocellular carcinoma metastasis

The receiver operating characteristic (ROC) curve analysis has shown that IL-34 has more discriminatory power than C-reactive protein (CRP) for the risk of diabetic complications. The cut-off value for IL-34 was established as 91.2 pg/mL. The gist of our research was identification of IL-34 as an additional potential inflammatory biomarker for the prediction of the risk of vascular diabetic complications.
The IL-34/STAT3/miR-21 pathway is crucial for the survival of synovial fibroblasts in rheumatoid arthritis
Data indicate that the interleukin 34 (IL-34) is a feasible diagnostic marker of liver fibrosis in non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) patients.
pathogenic role for IL34 in mediating immunosuppression and chemoresistance and identify it as a tractable target for anticancer therapy.

The current study aimed to assess the IL-34 expression in response to two members of the transforming growth factor (TGF)-beta family, TGF-beta1 and bone morphogenetic protein (BMP)-2, in synovial fibroblasts from rheumatoid arthritis patients.

In conclusion, elevated serum IL-34 levels were demonstrated to be independently associated with renal insufficiency and coronary artery disease in patients with chronic heart failure, regardless of the systolic function.

Data show that both serum interleukin-34 (IL-34) and IL-34 mRNA in mononuclear leukocytes (PBMCs) in chronic hepatitis B virus (HBV) patients was significantly decreased compared to the healthy controls.
Findings uncover a novel function for IKKbeta/mHTTx1 interactions in regulating IL-34 production, and implicate a role for IL-34 in non-cell-autonomous, microglial-dependent neurodegeneration in HD.

Data showed that single expression of M-CSF or IL-34 can be observed in lung cancer tissues and correlated with poor survival. Additionally, their high co-expression correlates with disease stages and poor survival. Thus, evaluating the expression of both M-CSF and IL-34 may help to estimate disease progression and malignant degree in lung cancer patients.

Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE) patients with detectable IL-34 levels had higher SLE Disease Activity Index (SLEDAI) and IgG concentrations and lower C3 and Hb levels than patients with undetectable IL-34 levels. Therefore, IL-34 could be a potential disease activity marker for SLE.
Our study shows that IL-34 is produced at the fetal-maternal interface by both placental cyto- and syncytiotrophoblasts and decidual stromal cells.
Study indicates that IL-34 can be an indicator of liver inflammation and fibrosis in patients with chronic hepatitis B virus infection.
this study shows that IL-34 regulates IL-6 and IL-8 production in human lung fibroblasts via MAPK, PI3K-Akt, JAK and NF-kappaB signaling pathways
Increased serum IL-34 levels were associated with greater frequency and severity of interstitial lung disease in systemic sclerosis patients.

Using a small amount of peripheral blood,successfully detected possible neuron-derived exosome-related blood biomarkers. This is the first study to suggest that not only SYP and TNFR1 but also IL34 are important blood biomarkers for patients with Manic Depressive Disorder.
Study found that high IL-34 levels in synovial fluid were significantly associated with the radiographic and symptomatic severity of knee osteoarthritis.
The IL-34-Mvarphis express significantly greater levels of pertinent restriction factor genes.
Sporadic vestibular schwannoma expressed IL-34 as well, but no significant differences were found in relation to clinicopathological characteristics.

This study describes for the first time the expression of IL-34 in multiple myeloma cells, indicating that it may enhance osteolysis. Targeting Il34 by specific small interfering RNA impaired osteoclast formation in vitro and attenuated osteolytic disease in vivo.
IL-6, IL-34 and M-CSFR may be closely related to the development of chronic periodontitis.
Wnt pathway regulates IL-34 level in lupus nephritis.
IL-34 may indirectly contribute to angiogenesis by promoting the production of VEGF and HIF-1alpha and participate in the pathogenesis of rheumatoid arthritis
IL-34 enhances RANKL/OPG expression by rheumatoid arthritis-fibroblast-like synoviocytes and rheumatoid arthritis-peripheral blood mononuclear cells.
Plasma levels of IL-34 in Haemorrhagic fever with renal syndrome patients were significantly elevated in acute phase and correlated with disease severity-reflecting parameters.
that IL-34 contributes to hepatitis B virus-mediated functional abnormality of hepatocellular carcinoma cells
Autocrine Production of Interleukin-34 Promotes the Development of Endometriosis through CSF1R/JAK3/STAT6 signaling.
Serum levels of interleukin-34 and clinical correlation in patients with primary Sjogren's syndrome.
Schwann cells orchestrate peripheral nerve inflammation through the expression of CSF1, IL-34, and SCF in amyotrophic lateral sclerosis.
Interleukin-34 expression in ovarian cancer: a possible correlation with disease progression.
IL-34 is a potential biomarker for the treatment of papillary thyroid cancer.
Interleukin-34 contributes to poor prognosis in triple-negative breast cancer.
Involvement of the M-CSF/IL-34/CSF-1R pathway in malignant pleural mesothelioma.
Increased Levels of IL-34 in Acquired Immune-Mediated Neuropathies.
IL-34 Actions on FOXP3(+) Tregs and CD14(+) Monocytes Control Human Graft Rejection.
Interleukin-34-CSF1R Signaling Axis Promotes Epithelial Cell Transformation and Breast Tumorigenesis.
Decreased Levels of Serum IL-34 Associated with Cognitive Impairment in Vascular Dementia.
Interleukin-34 accelerates intrauterine adhesions progress related to CX3CR1(+) monocytes/macrophages.
Increased serum interleukin-34 levels as a novel diagnostic and prognostic biomarker in patients with acute ischemic stroke.
Emerging roles of IL-34 in neurodegenerative and neurological infectious disease.
IL-34 affects fibroblast-like synoviocyte proliferation, apoptosis and function by regulating IL-17.
Bone morphogenetic protein 2 controls steroid-induced osteonecrosis of the femoral head via directly inhibiting interleukin-34 expression.
Association of Serum Interleukin-34 and Insulin Resistance with Cognitive Impairment in Patients with Cerebral Small Vessel Disease.
IL-34 in hepatoblastoma cells potentially promote tumor progression via autocrine and paracrine mechanisms.
IL-34 was high in serum of women with polycystic ovary syndrome and may function as potential diagnostic biomarker and therapeutic target.
IL-34 and coronary heart disease complicated with diabetes mellitus.", trans "IL-34.
Interleukin-34 Mediates Cross-Talk Between Stromal Cells and Immune Cells in the Gut.
Interleukin-34 permits Porphyromonas gingivalis survival and NF-kappaB p65 inhibition in macrophages.
IL-34 deficiency impairs FOXP3(+) Treg function in a model of autoimmune colitis and decreases immune tolerance homeostasis.
Sp1 Controls the Basal Level of Interleukin-34 Transcription.
BMP-2 Genome-Edited Human MSCs Protect against Cartilage Degeneration via Suppression of IL-34 in Collagen-Induced Arthritis.
A mechanism of IL-34-induced resistance against cytotoxic anti-cancer therapies such as radiation by X-ray and chemotherapy by Oxaliplatin.
Interleukin-34-NF-kappaB signaling aggravates myocardial ischemic/reperfusion injury by facilitating macrophage recruitment and polarization.
Elevated circulating levels of IL-34 are strongly associated with osteoporosis.
Elevated serum IL-34 is correlated with disease severity in patients with biliary atresia following Kasai portoenterostomy.
Cut-off value for interleukin-34 as an additional potential inflammatory biomarker for estimation of slow coronary flow risk.
Longitudinal associations between serum IL-34 with severity and prognosis in community-acquired pneumonia patients.
SAMHD1 dysfunction induces IL-34 expression via NF-kappaB p65 in neuronal SH-SY5Y cells.

positive regulation of cell population proliferation
positive regulation of MAP kinase activity
positive regulation of protein tyrosine kinase activity

name: interleukin 34

kegg.name: Viral protein interaction with cytokine and cytokine receptor - Homo sapiens (human)

reactome.name: Signaling by CSF1 (M-CSF) in myeloid cells

summary: Interleukin-34 is a cytokine that promotes the differentiation and viability of monocytes and macrophages through the colony-stimulating factor-1 receptor (CSF1R; MIM 164770) (Lin et al., 2008 [PubMed 18467591]).[supplied by OMIM, May 2008].
